title: The Prose Works of Sir Walter Scott. (Supplementary volume: containing notes, historical and illustrative, by the author, glossary, etc.)
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: He allowed that Flora Mac-Ivor was a fine woman,and Rose Bradwardine a pretty girl. But he allegedthat the former destroyed tlie effect of her beautyby an affectation of the grand airs which she hadprobably seen practised in the mock court of StGermains. As for Rose Bradwardine, he said itwas impossible for any mortal to admire such a littleuninformed thing, whose small portion of educationwas as ill adapted to her sex or youth, as if she hadappeared with one of her father's old campaign-coatsupon her person for her sole garment.
